headline: Herschel Walker's financial reporting 'may raise questions for voters,' expert says
author: Rebekah Sager
sentences:
By him going out, giving up all the energy, now we're not energy independent anymore, which started the whole downfall" -- Herschel Walker's analysis of energy policy doesn't show a grasp of details or really anything at all pic.twitter.com/WR5GkqS8ma
 Aaron Rupar (@atrupar) April 10, 2022
Meanwhile, although Walker was more than willing to chat up Fox News Maria Bartiromo Sunday morning, he skipped out on the first major GOP Senate debate on Saturday.

One example of Walkers possibly opaque reporting comes from Stephen Spaulding, a senior adviser at Common Cause, a government watchdog organization.

Its incredibly difficult for me to understand a world where Senate candidate Herschel Walkera man whos touted a spray that kills COVID-19, lied about finishing college, and doubts evolutioncould beat the incumbent Sen. Raphael Warnock, senior pastor at Ebenezer Baptist Church in Atlanta, a Democrat, and the first Black senator elected to serve in the state.

Delaney Marsco, a senior legal counsel for ethics at the Campaign Legal Center told GPB that The lack of sources of compensation over $5,000 definitely raises some red flags  Its very odd that there would be somebody who has a consulting firm, has a lot of money from that consulting firm but is not reporting any clients that are paying over $5,000.

According to ArcaMax, Agriculture Commissioner Gary Black, one of Walkers most well-known GOP opponents, called Walkers no-show a shame and then brought up his domestic violence accusations, arguing that Anyone who has put their hands on a woman, who has stalked, has threatened police with shootouts does not deserve to be in the U.S. Senate.

According to this candidates financial disclosure form, no person or entity paid more than $5,000 for any services provided by himat the same time, he disclosed an interest in an LLC valued at more than $25 million and that provides business consulting and professional services, Spaulding told GPB.

Contractor and veteran Kelvin King added that "Mr. Walker not showing up and not making himself available to the people of Georgia is not serving the people of Georgia  This is an interview process and if you don't show up for the interview process you don't get the job."

He appeared on Fox News Sunday, calling himself a warrior of God and claiming that President Bidens administration decided to give up our energy and now we're not energy independent anymore, while clearly advocating for more oil drilling.

This may raise questions for voters trying to screen for conflicts of interest who want to know more about who got what from the consulting and professional consulting firm that bears his name and pays him millions in shareholder income.
According to Georgia Public Broadcasting (GPB), Walkers personal financial disclosures are murky, which could make it challenging for voters to discern exactly who hes aligned with.
Obviously, he hasnt read or doesnt believe the recent climate report released on April 4 that essentially gives the planet three years to stop the worst of global warming, or else.
In addition to this latest reporting, Walker has openly admitted to mental health issues, along with accusations from his ex-wife of domestic violence.

But beyond exaggerating or lying, Walker seems mostly unable to comprehend complex political concepts.
The question that has currently popped up, among others, is: Where does all of his money come from?
According to the Associated Press, Walker also has had an ongoing issue inflating his wealth.
That's not just journalists, but fact-checkers, editors, and administrative staff.
And his income from the end of 2020 to the end of 2021 was reportedly $4 million.
